unittitle.value: Murray Bookchin Manuscript for <emph render="italic">Free Cities: Communalism and the Left</emph>

abstract.value: Murray Bookchin (1921-2006) was an American anarchist and social ecologist. This collection contains the manuscript for his final book, <emph render="italic">Free Cities: Communalism and the Left</emph>, published by Pluto Press in 2008.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Murray Bookchin Manuscript for<emph render="italic"> Free Cities: Communalism and the Left</emph>; TAM 538; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Eirik Eiglad, editor of <emph render="italic">Free Cities: Communalism and the Left</emph>, in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.041.

Murray Bookchin (1921-2006) was an American anarchist and social ecologist. Formerly a Communist and Trotskyist, he later became an anarchist and a founder of the social ecology movement, which seeks to combine insights from anarchism (and from the Marxian Left) with ecological concerns.

Table of Contents: Editor's preface: Creating free cities -- Introduction, by Murray Bookchin -- The ecological crisis and the need to remake society -- Nationalism and the "National Question" -- Nationalism and the great revolutions --The historical importance of the city -- Anarchism as individualism -- Anarchism, power, and government -- The revolutionary politics of libertarian municipalism -- The future of the left -- Toward a communalist approach -- Endnotes.
